name: Shrugs on Multipress
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a bar with multiple grip positions, such as a multipress or a dumbbell rack.

2. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing upwards) at shoulder-width apart.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and pull your shoulders down to engage your trapezius muscles.

4. Keeping your elbows straight and your core engaged, perform a shrug by lifting the weight up towards your chin for 2-3 seconds.

5. Lower the weight back down to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your core tight and your movements precise throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Shrugs on Multipress are an upper body exercise that target the trapezius muscles, primarily located at the base of the neck and connecting to the spine.
